featured.text: Once thought to be extremely rare, synesthesia is now found to affect about one to four percent of the population.
Meanwhile, environmental influences seem to shape a person’s synesthesia.
Scientists agree that synesthesia has a genetic basis, because it frequently runs in families.
Synesthesia is a condition in which people’s senses intermix.
In some cases, people with synesthesia may experience colors when they hear, read, or even think of letters and numbers.

other.text: Also, people with color-music synesthesia more often than not have had early musical training.
If so, it is very likely that you have synesthesia.
Is synesthesia genetically inherited or acquired after birth?
But an actual synesthesia gene (or genes) has not been identified yet.
Researchers further point out that in most people synesthesia is active only during the first months of their infancy, while this ability remains forever in certain individuals.
This consistency serves as a proof that synesthesia is real.
For example, the flavors people with taste-word synesthesia experience are usually childhood flavors, such as chocolate or strawberries.

definition.zh_def: 共感覺，一種感官交錯的現象，某些感官刺激會引發其他感官的感知。
definition.en_def: A neurological condition where stimulation of one sensory pathway leads to automatic, involuntary experiences in a second sensory pathway.
definition.example: For her, numbers have colors due to her synesthesia.
